info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:48AM EST until January 11 at 4:16PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...North Carolina... New River At Allisonia affecting Wythe and Pulaski Counties. Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal affecting Charlotte, Halifax and Campbell Counties. Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Charlotte and Halifax Counties. Dan River at South Boston affecting Halifax County. Dan River near Danville affecting Pittsylvania, Rockingham, Caswell and the City of Danville. Dan River at Paces affecting Halifax County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia...North Carolina... Pigg River Near Sandy Level affecting Pittsylvania County. Dan River Near Wentworth affecting Rockingham County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Altavista affecting Pittsylvania and Campbell Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Brookneal...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Roanoke River...including the Pigg River near Sandy Level, and Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Dan River...including Wentworth, Danville, Paces, and South Boston...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Dan River at Dan River at Paces. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Low spots along Routes 658 and 671 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 20.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 22.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.4 feet on 02/17/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1100 AM EST.
